conclusion: The light source moving to the back right will affect the position and size of shadows A, B, C, and D.
The image shows four objects: A (cake), B (umbrella), C (bandage roll), and D (ring), each casting shadows on the ground.
The shadow of A (cake) will shift towards the front left and appear elongated and skewed in that direction.
The shadow of B (umbrella) will shift towards the front left and elongate in that direction.
The shadow of C (bandage roll) will move towards the front left and elongate in that direction.
The shadow of D (ring) will shift towards the front left and extend in that direction.
Since the light is moving towards the right, the shadows will become longer and more elongated towards the front left.
Overall, each shadow will elongate and shift towards the front left as the light source moves to the back right.
